article:
{{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Australian Security Intelligence
Organisation |logo = ASIO crest.svg |logo_width = 350px |headquarters =
Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia |formed = 16 March 1949
|jurisdiction = Commonwealth of Australia |employees = 1,760 (at 30 June
2012) |budget = A$409.2 m (2011â12) |minister1_name = Mark Dreyfus QC MP |minister1_pfo = Attorney-
General |chief1_name = David Irvine AO |chief1_position = Director-
General of Security |parent_agency = Attorney-General's Department
|website = [http://www.asio.gov.au/ asio.gov.au] }} The 'Australian Security
Intelligence Organisation' ('ASIO'; ) is Australia's national security service,
which is responsible for the protection of the country and its citizens from
espionage, sabotage, acts of foreign interference, politically motivated
violence, attacks on the Australian defence system, and terrorism. {{cite web |title=Australian Security Intelligence Organisation
Act 1979 |date=2 April 2007 |url=http://legislation.gov.au/ComLaw/Legislation/A-
ctCompilation1.nsf/previewlodgmentattachments/170CC4C2D78008D3CA257341000B8B74/-
$file/ASIO1979_WD02.htm |publisher=Office of Legislative Drafting and Publishing
|accessdate=30 October 2007 }} http://www.asio.gov.au/About-
ASIO/Overview.html

ASIO is comparable with the United Kingdom Security Service (MI5). As with MI5
officers, ASIO officers have no police powers of arrest and are not armed. {{cite web |title=ASIO
Frequently Asked Questions |publisher=Australian Security Intelligence
Organisation |url=http://www.asio.gov.au/About/Content/Faq.aspx |accessdate=30
October 2007
| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20071028155755/http://www.asio.gov.au/-
| About/Content/Faq.aspx| archivedate= 28 October 2007 | deadurl=
| no}} ASIO operations requiring police powers are co-ordinated with the
| Australian Federal Police and/or with State and Territory police forces.

ASIO Central Office is in Canberra, with a local office being located in each
mainland state and territory capital. {{cite web
|title=ASIO Contact Information Page |date=
|url=http://asio.gov.au/Contact/Contact.aspx |publisher=Australian Security
Intelligence Organisation |accessdate=30 October 2007
| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20071024131655/http://www.asio.gov.au/-
| Contact/Contact.aspx| archivedate= 24 October 2007 | deadurl=
| no}} A new AUD $630 million Central Office, named the Ben Chifley
| Building, was officially opened by the Prime Minister Kevin Rudd on 23 July
| 2013.
headings: Relationships with foreign agencies and services
